feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 8:44AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN THROUGH SATURDAY... An atmospheric river is affecting the northern half of Southeast Alaska. As of 8 AM Saturday, Yakutat and Juneau have measured 1-2 inches of rain, while Sitka and Pelican measured 2-3 inches. A wave in the front will cause a resurgence of rainfall rates Saturday afternoon with an additional 0.5-1.5 inches expected.

entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches are expected above 3000 feet, with 1 to 3 inches from 2000 to 3000 feet.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 4:28AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cool And Wet Into Next Week... Northern Alaska is now in a cool and wet pattern that will last through next week. This will bring periods of snow to areas of the Interior above 3000 ft this weekend.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:55PM MDT until August 06 at 3:45PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR CENTRAL NATRONA COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 300 PM MDT...
